title: MATA NUI
description: Mata Nui was once an island paradise. The island featured tall icy mountains, deep ocean bays, wide desert expanses, caves deep underground, lush green jungles, even a volcano. For a thousand years, Matoran lived in six villages, each ruled by a wise Turaga, bothered only by the occasional rahi beast.
info: Jungle, glacier, desert, volcano, tunnels, bay

title: METRU NUI
description: The City of Legends, Metru Nui was a great metropolis. Resting in a sea of liquid protodermis, the city and was widely known for its quality of craftsmanship and high standards.
info: Floating in a sea of Protodermis below Mata Nui

title: VOYA NUI
description: The unforgiving island of Voya Nui was a wasteland. This island of doom, as its Matoran inhabitants named it, held secrets that forced the island to become the center of battles between powerful foes.
info: Floating in the Endless Ocean above Mahri Nui and The Pit
Rugged and inhospitable; also known as the Daggers of Death

title: MAHRI NUI
description: This sunken village of Mahri Nui was surrounded by air bubbles, which allowed its Matoran villagers to survive. Once a part of the floating island of Voya Nui, this submerged village remained linked to Voya Nui through a stone cord.
info: Resting on the lip of The Pit, below Voya Nui
Surrounded by air bubbles and connected by a stone cord to Voya Nui

title: KARDA NUI
description: The cave of Karda Nui, “the world that feeds the world,”. The bottom of the cave is submerged and enormous, strangely shaped stalactites have dropped from the ceiling. The water of Karda Nui is a mixture of liquid protodermis and saltwater.
info: Beneath where Voya Nui once floated
Massive stalactites that have fallen and now host Matoran villages; featureless mist obscuring the bottom

title: BARA MAGNA
description: Once, Bara Magna was part of a larger world, until a terrible disaster split the planet into three segments. Bara Magna is the largest of these, with the other two now acting as moons to it. While many of the residents of Bara Magna are native to the region, others were trapped there when their homelands broke away.
info: An undisclosed distance from Mata Nui’s ocean world
Desert, liquid sand desert, and more desert
